page.title: 06LOCAL FARMING (CONT)
page.content: August or September.During the last few years{Oil seed rape}has been appearing in our contryside. This is the bright yellow crop which we see in the spring.This crop is combined in autum and the seeds are processed to remove the oil for{marjarine} production etc. We see plenty of{sugar beet}about.This is sown in spring and is lifted and sent to the beet factory Allscott Nr.Telford from October to January. Plenty of{sweeds}are grown for sheep feed but these days not many{mangolds} are grown as they require too much labour which is expensive.
